items.message:
Flooding is possible in this area.

Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Avoid using low lying footpaths or entering areas prone to flooding. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.  
We continue to monitor the situation.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.
The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides.
After this tide‚ the weather is more settled and no further impacts are expected.
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.description: The tidal River Waveney from Ellingham to Breydon Water
items.message: Levels are now steadily falling, but still remain quite high in some locations. The forecast is for no significant flood risk from high tides. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.message: The flood warning for the Marston Meysey Brook has now been removed. This flood warning was issued in error due to a technical fault. The Flood Alert for the River Thames and its small tributaries from Calcutt to Lechlade remains in force. We apologise for the concern this may have caused you.
